s.text: It's sound bite heaven for President Clinton's legal team, as all three papers' leads include the White House's characterization of the Starr investigation as a "hit-and-run smear campaign."
A NYT op-ed asks several public figures, including Mario Cuomo and William F. Buckley Jr., to recommend comeback strategies for the down-and-out President.
Meanwhile, the nation's economy continues to suffer, with the lower and middle economic classes taking the hardest hit.
A WP front page piece examines a prickly side-effect of the Starr report's release: the heightened risk of curious ten-year-olds asking parents what "oral sex" is.
